page.title: 07HOUSING SURVEY - WOOTTON
page.content: Most houses in Wootton are between ten and eighty years old. Most houses in Wootton High Street are detached with large gardens and are structurally sound but they suffer a lot from heavy traffic passing through the village on the main road from Ryde to Newport. In general the houses are well-maintained, sometimes with the help of local authority grants. Houses tend to be occupied by single families of many ages and in general of a higher than average income . Housing problems include the close proximity of the A3054, noise and occasional vandalism particularly in summer. Originally the village grew along the main road but in recent years has expanded as new housing estates have been constructed, particularly on the northern side of the village.
